Inequality on the rise in France amid a staggering surge in income among the ultrarich
subhead: The wealthiest 0.1% of French people earn, on average, 167 times more than the quarter of households with the lowest incomes, according to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies. The gap has widened dramatically over the past 20 years, while reforms introduced by Emmanuel Macron have reduced the tax rate for the richest households.

headline: Dozens killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza
subhead: The strikes on Wednesday were among the deadliest in Gaza since the truce entered into force last month, and came as Israel also announced a string of attacks targeting Hezbollah in Lebanon in spite of a nearly year-long ceasefire there.

headline: 'Eleanor the Great': Scarlett Johansson's successful directorial debut
subhead: The actress directs the story of an initially harmless lie of an old woman who usurps the story of a deceased friend who survived a concentration camp after being deported.

headline: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.

headline: COP30 presents an existential issue for Indigenous peoples
subhead: The global climate conference was meant to be a moment of recognition for Indigenous peoples, who have been placed at the heart of President Lula's political agenda. Yet, faced with the Brazilian president's contradictions, Indigenous activists have come to the fore, determined to make their voices heard at a summit that directly affects them.

headline: 'Worthy of Game of Thrones': The EU Commission's battle for control of diplomacy
subhead: The president of the institution, Ursula von der Leyen, has been consolidating more and more powers, to the detriment of the historic diplomatic service led by Estonian Kaja Kallas, who now appears increasingly isolated.
